bibliography.AU: Briones, J; Montaigne, F; Hehn, M; Lacour, D; Childress, JR; Carey, MJ
bibliography.AF: Briones, Joel; Montaigne, Francois; Hehn, Michel; Lacour, Daniel; Childress, Jeffrey R.; Carey, Matthew J.
bibliography.TI: Stochastic and complex depinning dynamics of magnetic domain walls
bibliography.AB: We study the thermally induced depinning process of a single magnetic domain wall (DW) under applied field when the DW is trapped by a notch made in a nanowire shaped from a spin-valve multilayer with in-plane magnetization. In such devices depinning is typically a stochastic process and the depinning field distribution exhibits complex features. By analyzing simultaneously depinning field distributions and relaxation data, we observe two distinct sources of "complexity" in DW depinning processes: multiplicity in the DW structure and fundamental complexity in the depinning process.
